Anyone who takes the position “But Core is the defacto standard everyone follows” doesn’t understand that the current in situ, SegWit-enabled Bitcoin protocol wouldn’t exist if the market strictly followed Core because Core only supported BIP8. I concur with 
@BobMcElrath
Bob McElrath
@BobMcElrath
 · Oct 6, 2018
It doesn't matter who has commit access to the bitcoin repo. This is a red herring. Consensus rules define the system, not commit access. It's BIP9 soft forks only from here on out folks and doesn't matter which repo it came from, as long as it follows the rules. t.co/hurhSBIxHb
